messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Microscopes?
messages.msgSnippet: This is the one I ve lusted after for the last few years: http://www.kk.org/cooltools/archives/000056.php It s around $160, though : We have one that my
messages.messageBody:
This is the one I've lusted after for the last few years:

http://www.kk.org/cooltools/archives/000056.php

It's around $160, though :\

We have one that my husband had in college, but we'll be purchasing that one
this year so that we don't have to be so careful and so the boys can use it
without so much supervision.

--
Jenniffer in Harpers Ferry
http://octopigarden.blogspot.com
Listen, are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life? ~Mary Oliver


On 6/3/06, squeakybiscuit <squeakybiscuit@...> wrote:
>
> I was wanting to purchase a microscope. I was wanting a lab quality
> microscope at a toy microscope price LOL...ok, as close as I can get
> for under $100.
>
> I've tried the $20-$30 ones before and you can't see a thing. I was
> looking for a microscope for my 13,12 and 8 year old that we would
> actually be able to see well in.
>
> Any recommendations?
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Microscopes?
messages.msgSnippet: I was wanting to purchase a microscope. I was wanting a lab quality microscope at a toy microscope price LOL...ok,  as close as I can get for under $100. I ve
messages.messageBody:
I was wanting to purchase a microscope. I was wanting a lab quality
microscope at a toy microscope price LOL...ok, as close as I can get
for under $100.

I've tried the $20-$30 ones before and you can't see a thing. I was
looking for a microscope for my 13,12 and 8 year old that we would
actually be able to see well in.

Any recommendations?
